German Emigration Center Bremerhaven

An exciting journey through 300 years of emigration and immigration history

Waiting on the wharf, waving good-bye from the gangway, then the journey starts. For more than seven million emigrants, who left from Bremerhaven between 1830-1974 on their journey to the New World, this is the moment of departure. For the visitors of the German Emigration Center this is the start of their travel through 300 years of German migration history.

Located on that very harbor where the emigrant ships departed you will now find the awarded theme museum in which vistors follow the personal path of an emigrant from the time of departure, to the conditions experienced during the crossing up until the arrival in the New World. After emigrating to the New World visitors immigrate to Germany: In a reconstructed shopping mall of the year 1973, the year the Federal Republic of Germany enacted a recruitment Stopp for foreign workerk, visitors trace the footsteps of immigrants such as Huguenots, Guest Workers or Syrian civil war refugees.

Impressions

At the end of the tour visitors have the opportunity to embark on a personal search for their own ancestors in two international databases.

Aside from the permanent exhibition, changing special exhibitions, events and seminars deal more closely with various aspects of migration.

from November to February

150 minutes on average length of stay

Tickets and admission fees

Entrance fees 2017

- Adults € 14,50
- Children (aged 5-16) € 8,80
- Reduced (Eldery) € 13,90
- Reduced (Students/Pupils) € 12,50
- Disabled person 50 % € 12,50
- Families (2 adults + children 5-16 aged) € 38,00
- Single Mom/Dad (1 adult + children 5-16 aged) € 25,00
- Degree of disability 100 % cost free admission
- Group rates on request.

print@home Ticket - Adults

(Valid on day of purchase and the subsequent two days and for one-time visit to the respective facility; not available from 1st November 2017 till 31st January 2018):
- Adults € 18,00
- Reduced (Eldery) € 15,80
- Reduced (Students, Pupils, Trainees, Unemployed, Disabled person) € 14,30
- Families (2 adults + children 4-16 aged) € 48,00

Notice

The ticket vouchers that can be purchased via the Bremerhaven Tourist Board must be changed for tickets at the box office of the German Emigration Center!
